message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of index coding, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The problem involves communication networks, which suggests that it could also belong to the networking and internet architecture category (cs.NI). The paper also uses graph theory to model the problem, which falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The use of side-information at the receivers and the optimization of broadcast transmissions are topics in signal processing and optimization, respectively, which could place the paper under the categories of signal processing (cs.SI) and machine learning (cs.LG).
